page.title: 11 The M1 Motorway
page.content: The M1 motorway ends just past the {roundabout at Stangmore}and since completion in{1968}has been of great benefit to the people of Dungannon and beyond.It shortened the journey from Belfast to Dungannon by about 45 minutes.The 37 mile journey can now be done in half an hour in safety although some serious fatal accidents have occurred when drivers have got on to the wrong carriageway. Various contractors completed different sections of the motorway. The last section,the{Laghey section, was opened at{11.00 a.m on Saturday {23rd December,1967.} There was no official opening due to the risk of spreading 'foot and mouth disease' which is a serious animal illness. The contractor was{Mr.Graham of Dromore and he completed the{4.25 million {pounds}contract 8 months early.
